page.title: 14Historic Building:Landue
page.content: {Landue House}is 600 years old.There are three parts to the house.{Mr. {Tregoning}who owns the building lives in the main part.Mr.Tregoning's wife used to draw postcards and sell them to the local shop in Lezant but she died several years ago.At the back there was once a place which was rented by a family but now they have moved out.The house has four gardens all are very large.Mr. Tregoning owns some woods.The Tregoning family bought the house from Colonel.Paul Phillippas in 1867 for Â£15000.That was including the mansion and grounds of 400 acres.Now there are still 400 acres.Mr.Tregoning used to invite the hunting hounds every year on one of his lawns and people were allowed to come and see them.
